uk.co.strangeskies.reflection

Class Resolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.strangeskies.reflection.Resolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Copyable<Resolver>, DeepCopyable<Resolver>

    public class Resolver
extends Object
implements DeepCopyable<Resolver>

    A Resolver represents a view over an underlying BoundSet, and provides a number of important functionalities for interacting with that BoundSet. Multiple Resolvers can provide different views of the same BoundSet instance.

    Whenever any InferenceVariable is created by way of a Resolver instance, that InferenceVariable will be associated with a particular GenericDeclaration. Within this context, which is so described by a GenericDeclaration, at most only one InferenceVariable may by created for any given TypeVariable. A Resolver always creates InferenceVariable according to the behaviour of inferOverTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration).

    A Resolver is a flexible and powerful tool, but for typical use-cases it may be recommended to use the more limited, but more type safe, facilities provided by the TypeToken and Invokable classes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Create a new resolver over a new bound set.

IntersectionType as per captureType(Type) invoked for each member. WildcardType as per inferOverWildcardType(WildcardType).

      • deepCopy

        public Resolver deepCopy(Map<InferenceVariable,InferenceVariable> inferenceVariableSubstitutions)
        Create a copy of an existing resolver. All the inference variables contained within the resolver will be substituted for the new inference variables, and all the bounds on them will be substituted for equivalent bounds. These mappings will be entered into the given map when they are made.
        Parameters:
        inferenceVariableSubstitutions - A map which will contain mappings from inference variables which are mentioned in the resolver to the new inference variables they have been substituted with in the derived resolver.
        Returns:
        A newly derived resolver, with each instance of an inference variable substituted for new mappings.

      • withInferenceVariableSubstitution

        public Resolver withInferenceVariableSubstitution(Map<InferenceVariable,InferenceVariable> inferenceVariableSubstitutions)
        Create a copy of an existing resolver. All the inference variables contained within the resolver will be substituted for the values they index to in the given map in the new resolver, and all the bounds on them will be substituted for equivalent bounds.
        Parameters:
        inferenceVariableSubstitutions - A mapping from inference variables which may be mentioned in the resolver to inference variables they should be substituted for in the derived resolver.
        Returns:
        A newly derived resolver, with each instance of an inference variable substituted for its mapping in the given map, where one exists.

      • getBounds

        public BoundSet getBounds()
        Returns:
        The bound set backing this resolver.

      • inferOverTypeParameters

        public Map<TypeVariable<?>,InferenceVariable> inferOverTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration declaration)
        Each type variable within the given GenericDeclaration, and each non-statically enclosing declaration thereof, is incorporated into the backing BoundSet. Each new InferenceVariable created in this process is registered in this Resolver under the given declaration, including those of enclosing GenericDeclarations.

        If the declaration is a non-static Executable, first the declaring class is incorporated, then the resulting inference variables are also registered under the Executable, then the type parameters of the Executable itself are registered. This means that any Executables registered within a single resolver will always share the inference variables on their declaring class with those registered directly under that class.

        Parameters:
        declaration - The declaration we wish to incorporate.
        Returns:
        A mapping from the InferenceVariables on the given declaration, to their new capturing InferenceVariables.

      • captureType

        public Type captureType(Type type)
        The given type is captured into the resolver, in a fashion dictated by the class of that type, as follows:
        • Class as per inferOverTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration) .
        • ParameterizedType as per captureTypeArguments(ParameterizedType).
        • GenericArrayType as per captureType(Type) invoked for it's component type.
        • IntersectionType as per captureType(Type) invoked for each member.
        • WildcardType as per inferOverWildcardType(WildcardType).
        Parameters:
        type - The type we wish to incorporate.
        Returns:
        The new internal representation of the given type, which may substitute type variable captures in place of wildcards.

      • inferOverType

        public Type inferOverType(Type type)
        The given type is incorporated into the resolver, in a fashion dictated by the class of that type, as follows:
        • Class as per inferOverTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration) .
        • ParameterizedType as per captureTypeArguments(ParameterizedType).
        • GenericArrayType as per captureType(Type) invoked for it's component type.
        • IntersectionType as per captureType(Type) invoked for each member.
        • WildcardType as per inferOverWildcardType(WildcardType).
        Parameters:
        type - The type we wish to incorporate.
        Returns:
        The new internal representation of the given type, which may substitute type variable captures in place of wildcards.

      • inferOverWildcardType

        public InferenceVariable inferOverWildcardType(WildcardType type)
        Incorporate a new inference variable for a given wildcard type, and add the bounds of the wildcard as bounds to the inference variable.
        Parameters:
        type - The wildcard type to capture as a bounded inference variable.
        Returns:
        The new inference variable created to satisfy the given wildcard.

      • inferOverTypeArguments

        public GenericArrayType inferOverTypeArguments(GenericArrayType type)
        Add inference variables for the type parameters of the given type to the resolver, then incorporate containment constraints based on the arguments of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose generic type arguments we wish to perform inference operations over.
        Returns:
        A parameterized type derived from the given type, with inference variables in place of wildcards where appropriate.

      • inferOverTypeArguments

        public ParameterizedType inferOverTypeArguments(ParameterizedType type)
        Add inference variables for the type parameters of the given type to the resolver, then incorporate containment constraints based on the arguments of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose generic type arguments we wish to perform inference operations over.
        Returns:
        A parameterized type derived from the given type, with inference variables in place of wildcards where appropriate.

      • getProperUpperBounds

        public Set<Type> getProperUpperBounds(Type type)
        Find the upper bounds of a given type. Unlike Types.getUpperBounds(Type) this respects bounds on the inference variables in this resolver.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose bounds we wish to discover.
        Returns:
        The upper bounds of the given type.

      • getProperLowerBounds

        public Set<Type> getProperLowerBounds(Type type)
        Find the lower bounds of a given type. Unlike Types.getLowerBounds(Type) this respects bounds on the inference variables in this resolver.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose bounds we wish to discover.
        Returns:
        The lower bounds of the given type, or null if no such bounds exist.

      • captureTypeArguments

        public ParameterizedType captureTypeArguments(ParameterizedType type)

        Parameters:
        type - The type whose generic type arguments we wish to capture.
        Returns:

      • resubstituteCapturedWildcards

        Parameters:
        type - The type for which we wish to make the substitution.
        Returns:
        A new type derived from that given by making the substitution.

      • incorporateWildcardCaptures

      • incorporateInstantiation

        public void incorporateInstantiation(TypeVariable<?> variable,
                                     Type instantiation)
        Incorporate an instantiation for a type variable. In other words, find the InferenceVariable registered for the given TypeVariable under the GenericDeclaration it belongs to, and incorporate an equality bound on that inference variable to the given type.
        Parameters:
        variable - The type variable whose inference variable we wish to instantiate.
        instantiation - The type with which to instantiate the given type variable. This should be a proper type.

      • incorporateTypeHierarchy

        public void incorporateTypeHierarchy(Class<?> subclass,
                                     Class<?> superclass)
        Any type parameters of the given subclass and superclass are incorporated into the Resolver, as are the parameters of any classes between, i.e. those classes which are a supertype of the given subclass, and a subtype of the given superclass. For each subclass in the hierarchy which provides a parameterization of a corresponding superclass, these bounds are created and incorporated.

        This has the effect, when either the given subclass or superclass are generic, of establishing any relationship the type arguments of that class may have with the other class.

        Parameters:
        subclass - A subclass of the given superclass.
        superclass - A superclass of the given subclass.

      • infer

        public Map<InferenceVariable,Type> infer()
        Infer proper instantiations for each inference variable registered within this Resolver instance.
        Returns:
        A mapping from each inference variable registered under this resolver, to their newly inferred instantiations.

      • resolveTypeParametersWithResubstitutedWildcardCaptures

        public Type resolveTypeParametersWithResubstitutedWildcardCaptures(Class<?> type)
        Resolve the type parameters registered under the given class, and derive a parameterized type using these parameters if appropriate. If the given class is not generic, it is returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose parameterization we wish to determine within the context of this Resolver.
        Returns:
        A parameterized type over the given type, according to the inference variables and parameters registered in this resolver, or the given type if it is not generic.

      • resolveTypeParameters

        public Type resolveTypeParameters(Class<?> type)
        Resolve the type parameters registered under the given class, and derive a parameterized type using these parameters if appropriate. If the given class is not generic, it is returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose parameterization we wish to determine within the context of this Resolver.
        Returns:
        A parameterized type over the given type, according to the inference variables and parameters registered in this resolver, or the given type if it is not generic.

      • resolveTypeVariable

        public Type resolveTypeVariable(TypeVariable<?> typeVariable)
        Resolve the proper instantiation of a given TypeVariable if one exists. The type variable will be resolved to an InferenceVariable with respect to the context provided by its declaring class.
        Parameters:
        typeVariable - The type variable whose proper instantiation we wish to determine.
        Returns:
        The proper instantiation of the given TypeVariable if one exists, otherwise the TypeVariable itself.

      • resolveTypeVariable

        public Type resolveTypeVariable(GenericDeclaration declaration,
                                TypeVariable<?> typeVariable)
        Resolve the proper instantiation of a given TypeVariable if one exists. The type variable will be resolved to an InferenceVariable with respect to the context provided by the given GenericDeclaration.
        Parameters:
        declaration - The GenericDeclaration under which we will check registration of the given TypeVariable.
        typeVariable - The type variable whose proper instantiation we wish to determine.
        Returns:
        The proper instantiation of the given TypeVariable if one exists, otherwise the TypeVariable itself.

      • getInferenceVariables

        public Set<InferenceVariable> getInferenceVariables()
        Find all the inference variables which have been created through interaction with this Resolver. Note that this set of collections may only be a subset of those which would be returned by an invocation of BoundSet.getInferenceVariables() on the underlying resolver.
        Returns:
        The set of variables incorporated into this Resolver.

      • getInferenceVariables

        public Map<TypeVariable<?>,InferenceVariable> getInferenceVariables(GenericDeclaration declaration)
        Find all the inference variables registered within the context of the given GenericDeclaration. Typically this will be one for each of the TypeVariables in the declaration, and one for each TypeVariable in any non-statically enclosing classes.
        Parameters:
        declaration - The GenericDeclaration for which we will resolve inference variables.
        Returns:
        The set of variables incorporated into this Resolver under the context provided by the given declaration.
